meanings.definition: A partition that separates the compartments of a ship.
meanings.sent1: The bulkhead in the ship kept the cargo separate from the crew.
meanings.sent2: The sailors walked past the bulkhead to access the engine room.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous sailor tried to hide behind the bulkhead during the inspection.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a sturdy bulkhead, blocking out any doubts.
meanings.sent5: The sound of waves crashing against the bulkhead lulled the crew to sleep.

meanings.definition: A partition that separates the compartments of an aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The bulkhead in the aircraft had a small window for the pilot to see through.
meanings.sent2: Passengers waited patiently near the bulkhead for boarding to begin.
meanings.sent3: The flight attendant jokingly pretended to hide behind the bulkhead.
meanings.sent4: The turbulence felt like crashing into a solid bulkhead, jolting everyone on board.
meanings.sent5: The emergency exit was located next to the bulkhead for quick access.

meanings.definition: A partition that separates the compartments of a building.
meanings.sent1: The bulkhead in the building prevented noise from one room disturbing the others.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers installed the bulkhead to create separate office spaces.
meanings.sent3: The children played a game of hide-and-seek around the bulky bulkhead.
meanings.sent4: His emotions were like a fragile bulkhead, ready to collapse under pressure.
meanings.sent5: The colorful paintings on the bulkhead brightened up the hallway.
